sub_title: Freelance MEP CxA/ CxM/ RE for Jiffy Cx BV
summary:
A Senior Electrical Engineer & Commissioning Manager, with over 20+ construction industry experience from an electrical engineering background having recently complete commissioning of several data centres in the EMEA locations including Ireland, Denmark and Netherlands. Previous to this completing 2 No. 30MW Data Centres in Taiwan for a leading Global Corporation.
 
Experience includes managing the electrical & mechanical installation with an electrical bias on numerous commercial office buildings both new building and refurbishment schemes as well as the complete refurbishment of the famous All England Lawn Tennis Club Wimbledon Centre Court refurbishment, followed by Courts 2 & 3 projects.
 
Experiences in bidding work, technical advisory, high rise building fire alarm installation, BMW industrial refurbishment, sports stadium/ stadia.
 
I consider myself:
 
• Highly motivated 
• With sound technical knowledge in both electrical and mechanical aspects of M&E projects. (electrical bias)
• Enthusiastic 
• Diligent
• Honest 
• Conscientious
• Able to work to stringent deadlines 
• Able to work well under pressure
• Customer focused
• Results driven 
• Good communicator
• Self motivated 
• Deliver results on time 
 
I possess excellent operational skills and translate strategy into specific objectives and action plans. I constantly review risk management and program requirements.

profile_positions.description:
Providing SME, MEP specialism for projects in the EMEA region. Providing technical services to support and bolster projects primarily for data centres. A vast array of experience with most of the global corporations in Taiwan, Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Netherlands, Ireland, UK, Qatar, Macau, Hong Kong, Germany, Switzerland. 
Excellent understanding of technical requirements, contract requirements for compliance amongst other requirements. 
British citizen with full rights to work within the EU with Dutch residence. 
CxA/ CxM/ MEP/ QAQC Lead and-or Engineer
Process and procedure driven with integrity, compliance and absolute certainty. 
Commissioning management services 
Commissioning Authority services 
Technical assurance

Testing and commissioning 
Team building

MEP including HV, LV, lV distribution, lighting and lighting control systems, smart homes and apartments, BMS, security systems including CCTV & door access, chilled water from district cooling, AHU, FCU, RCU, potable and non potable water systems, fire fighting systems including water and clean agent such as FM 200 etc
profile_positions.title: Commissioning Manager

profile_positions.description:
June 1013- December 2014

Commenced employment with Commtech Asia ltd in 2013 as a Commissioning Manager.  In 2014 was utilised to the role of Senior Commissioning Manager and team leader.  Regular tasks included:-
 
• Communication including electronic, telephone and in person
• Site progress reviews and providing monthly progress reports
• Monitor and control commissioning managers as a team
• Part of a multi-disciplined team which works closely with the Client and numerous subcontractors to ensure co-ordination of services with specialists to deliver the project on time and on budget.
• Financial reviews with QS department
• Management and integration of programme of works
• Commissioning responsibility including commissioning strategies, report writing, document reviews, method statements reviewed and written, tracker documents etc
• Design evaluations i.e. cable calcs, bracketry, compliance to regulations etc,
• Records of meetings and regularly chair project meetings.
• Commissionability reviews
• Maintainability Reviews
• Prepare incident reports
• ​Maintain trackers and revise to reflect project requirements to effectively review progress of the project.
 
Project:
 
CHG-1 & CHG-2 Taiwan Data Centre  
Date:
 
Value:
+$600 Million dollar project to client. Commissioning Value circa & + $2 Million dollars
 
 
Scope of Project:
 
CHG-1 was a three stage project to release 30MW of beneficial data centre over a one year period in 10MW stages.
CHG-2 was a two stage project to release 30MW of beneficial data centre over a one year period in approx 15MW stages.
 
These projects were completed successfully and to the satisfaction of all parties and in particular the client in 2013 and 2014 respectively.
profile_positions.title: Commissioning Manager

profile_positions.description:
Commenced employment with Skanska Rashleigh Weatherfoil in 2007 as a Project Engineer based at AELTC Wimbledon.  In 2008 I was promoted to the role of Senior Project Engineer.
My day to day tasks include:-

•	Extensive communication including electronic, telephone and in person
•	Site progress, contract & tender reviews
•	Monitor and control supervisors and electrical staff
•	Review site instructions and select / design appropriate measures to co-ordinate to appropriate sub-contractors.
•	Part of a multi-disciplined team which works closely with the Client and numerous sub-contractors to ensure co-ordination of services with specialists to deliver the project on time and on budget.
•	Financial reviews with QS department
•	Estimating for tenders / budget costs for clients
•	Interviewing & management of Sub-Contractors
•	Management of procurement
•	Management and integration of programme of works
•	Commissioning responsibility
•	Design evaluations i.e. cable calcs, bracketry, compliance to regulations etc,
•	Records of meetings
•	Authorised Person for LV and oversee HV Works


Project:	AELTC Court 3 and Court 2, Wimbledon 
Date:	        2008 - 2011
Value:	£6million plus £1million in Variation Orders

Project:	AELTC Centre Court Redevelopment, Wimbledon
Date:	       2007 - 2009
Value:	£21 million including variations
